element.name: Silent Performance
element.prerequisite: Ability to cast at least 1 spell and play at least 1 instrument

p.i: Prerequisites: Ability to cast at least 1 spell and play at least 1 instrument

description.p: As a magical caster and performer you've spent several hours practicing your craft to be as unique and useful as possible. This allows you to gain the following benefits:

ul.li: -Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
-You gain proficiency in Performance. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

-When casting a spell with a verbal component you may make a Performance check against viewers' passive (Perception). If you are successful they are unaware of a spell being cast and believe it is just a performance. If you succeed by 5 or more you can choose to have the performance be silent.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency or expertise in Performance, can perform, replacing the verbal component of a spell, and can make it silent for other creatures.
